intro: Galium heldreichii subsp. protopycnotrichum, commonly known as the Balkan bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its subspecies status reflects distinct morphological and ecological adaptations compared to other Galium species.
